title: Look Down
focus: Identifying obstacles—physical, mental, and spiritual—that drag us down and fuel burnout.
description: Dig into the snares and stumbling blocks hindering your well-being and ministry effectiveness.

reflectionQuestions.prompt: What physical habits or conditions (poor sleep, inactivity, illness) weigh on your energy and service?
Which thought patterns (anxiety, perfectionism, negativity) trap your mind and cloud joy?
Where do cynicism, apathy, doubt, or temptation undermine your faith and drain your spirit?
Which ministry demands or personal patterns lead you toward exhaustion rather than rest?
How does shame, guilt, or unresolved grief manifest in your body, thoughts, or prayers?

tasks.description: Choose one snare in body, mind, or spirit; create an accountability plan with a trusted peer.
List triggers for mental or emotional drain and develop a coping rhythm (rest breaks, prayer pauses).
Identify a spiritual temptation or discouragement; counter it with a chosen Scripture or practice.
Seek professional help (counselor, spiritual director) to address deeper wounds or early burnout signs.

followUpPrompts.prompt: Which snare proved most persistent, and how did you begin to interrupt it?
What changes in sleep, thought patterns, or prayer life emerged?
How will you guard against returning to that stumbling block in the coming weeks?
